channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Zip line broken, 13th September
item.description:
Zip line has been out of action for a long time This is the most popular item in the playground and keeps kids of many ages occupied for a long time, while teaching waiting and sharing. Please fix.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malyons Road, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal HMO, 13th September
item.description:
111 Wickham street is operating an illegal HMO. The owner of the property has rented out several rooms in his house. These people are noisy and violent. They have parties until the early hours of the morning and shout abuse at me and my family. There are upwards of 6 people living in that house. This has been going on for the last couple of years and the situation is getting worse
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beal Close, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car blocking driveway, 13th September
item.description:
Car abandoned since at least 6:30am Sat 13th Sep 25. Car is blocking dropped curb and blocking the driveway of 6 Westfield Road. We at no 6 might be blocked in making it difficult to get to work or do the school run. We can’t make proper use of our driveway and if we park on the street, we’ll get a parking ticket. This very inconvenient and we’d like this to be looked into please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westfield Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Overflowing bins every week, 13th September
item.description:
I live in Parkdale Road, and the house at 149 is a HMO. They have 2 black top bins, which tend to be full most of the time. Foxes also ravage the bins and spread the rubbish across the street. The problem is aggravated by current bin collections: rubbish is only collected every other week, and although they have 2 bins only one is emptied, resulting in both bins usually being full all the time. As they have 2 black bins, can they not be emptied both at the same time? The issue is causing a lot of bad feeling. It gas gone on for months, but obviously worst in the Summer because of the random rubbish collections and the foxes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkdale Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot holes and bad road surface on Manor way as you approach the railway bridge., 13th September
item.description:
As you walk, or drive along Manor way, Bexley, ,just before the railway bridge heading to the car park , Paddel tennis , dance school,meadows or cricket ground there are 3 speed bumps. The road surface near the bumps is a damaged mess, which fills with water and mud and seems to be expanding. There seems to have been some patching done at times with concrete. I heard from a big cricket fan who went to the cricket week at the Bexley cricket ground in the summer, and who uses a push along walking aid. It was difficult for them to get to the cricket ground along Manor way without risking injury or tripping. The particular area of road is quite dark at night, so combined with the puddles, potholes and speed bumps, means it is a perilous walk back to the car park. The area of road seems to be worsening and as it used by commuters, dog walkers, walkers, families heading to the Cricket ground, dance school ,tennis club, and Meditation centre it would benefit everyone if it can be resurfaced. The road surface has always been a challenge for a few years but seems to have worsened a lot recently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Manor Way, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Root of the tree causing structural damage to the fence, which can fall anytime with high risk of falling on someone. This is a common route for pedestrian. Also, very close to school and i have children living in my house., 13th September
item.description:
This tree has been here over the years, however, I have observed that the root has grown bigger and deeper causing a deep structural damage on my fence (165 Holsten Way, DA18 4DH). I brought in a builder to repair the cracked wall but the structural damage is getting worse due to the fundamental cause being the root of the tree. The tree has to be uprooted urgently so that the cracked wall does not fall on my children or any other person. This is a communal area where pedestrian walk pass all the time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alsike Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mini Sink Hole / Pavement Collapsing, 13th September
item.description:
There appears to be a hole underneath the paving stones, and some of the paving stones have fallen through. There seems to be quite a bit of movement at either end of the drain. Need urgent attention.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rossendale Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
